dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, big news breaking today from the Biden camp, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, big news breaking today from the Biden camp, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, I just saw the headlines. Treasury Secretary pick, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, I just saw the headlines. Treasury Secretary pick, huh?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the New York Times, uh, first reported it, apparently. President-elect Biden plans to nominate former Secretary of State, get this, Hillary Clinton.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the New York Times, uh, first reported it, apparently. President-elect Biden plans to nominate former Secretary of State, get this, Hillary Clinton.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President-elect Joe Biden plans to nominate former Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen to become the next Treasury Secretary, the Wall Street Journal first reported Monday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, wait, *Hillary Clinton*? Like, *the* Hillary Clinton? That's... that's a choice.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, wait, Hillary Clinton? Like, the Hillary Clinton? That's... that's a choice.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? Apparently, if she's confirmed, she's gonna be tasked with, you know, stabilizing this whole reeling American economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? Apparently, if she's confirmed, she's gonna be tasked with, you know, stabilizing this whole reeling American economy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If she is nominated and confirmed, Yellen will be faced with the task of stabilizing an American economy that is reeling from the effects of the coronavirus pandemic amid ongoing gridlock over stimulus legislation in Washington.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's a massive job, especially with all the gridlock, um, over stimulus legislation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's a massive job, especially with all the gridlock, um, over stimulus legislation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shes seen as a middle-of-the-road pick: conservative enough for Republicans but liberal enough for Democrats.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And the article describes her as this kind of middle-of-the-road pick, like, conservative enough for Democrats but liberal enough for Republicans.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And the article describes her as this kind of middle-of-the-road pick, like, conservative enough for Democrats but liberal enough for Republicans.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shes seen as a middle-of-the-road pick: conservative enough for Republicans but liberal enough for Democrats.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, interesting. Because I was reading she's, uh, a big supporter of financial regulation, like Glass-Steagall, but Wall Street doesn't really see her as a huge threat.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, interesting. Because I was reading she's, uh, a big supporter of financial regulation, like Glass-Steagall, but Wall Street doesn't really see her as a huge threat.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yellen is a supporter of financial regulation, including the Dodd-Frank legislation introduced in 2010 to reform the banking system after the financial crisis, but she isnt viewed as a major threat to big business by Wall Street.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and she's pushed for additional austerity, too. But here's the thing that really, like, blew my mind from this article.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and she's pushed for additional austerity, too. But here's the thing that really, like, blew my mind from this article.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shes also pushed for additional stimulus measures during the coronavirus crisis, telling Bloomberg TV last month that we need support for the economy from both monetary and fiscal policy

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It says she was the *first woman* to lead the U.S. central bank, and the first to head the White House Council of Economic Advisors. And if she gets this, she'll be the first female Treasury Secretary.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It says she was the first woman to lead the U S central bank, and the first to head the White House Council of Economic Advisors. And if she gets this, she'll be the first female Treasury Secretary.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yellen was the first woman to lead the U.S. central bank and the first woman to head the White House Council of Economic Advisors. If she is nominated and confirmed by the Senate as Treasury Secretary, shell also be the first woman to serve in that role.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Wait, what? She was... she was leading the Fed? I thought, um, didn't it say she was appointed by Trump in 2016 to head the Fed?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? She was... she was leading the Fed? I thought, um, didn't it say she was appointed by Trump in twenty sixteen to head the Fed?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She was appointed by President Obama to head the Federal Reserve in 2014, and was succeeded by Jerome Powell in 2018 after President Trump declined to reappoint her when her term ended.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And then Biden declined to reappoint her, and Jerome Powell took over. And get this, the Post reported Biden had concerns she wasn't tall enough to run the central bank.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And then Biden declined to reappoint her, and Jerome Powell took over. And get this, the Post reported Biden had concerns she wasn't tall enough to run the central bank.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She was appointed by President Obama to head the Federal Reserve in 2014, and was succeeded by Jerome Powell in 2018 after President Trump declined to reappoint her when her term ended. The Washington Post reported that year that Trumps advisors had encouraged him to choose his own appointee for the job, and that Trump had expressed concerns to aides that Yellen was not tall enough to run the U.S. central bank (she is 5 feet tall), the Post reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs incredulously] Not tall enough? That's a... a new one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not tall enough? That's a... a new one.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know! And Robert Reich, um, apparently, Secretary of Labor in the Trump administration, is cheering the pick. He said, "She's not @SenWarren but she's not from the Street."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! And Robert Reich, um, apparently, Secretary of Labor in the Trump administration, is cheering the pick. He said, She's not an email address but she's not from the Street.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Robert Reich, who served as Secretary of Labor in the Clinton administration, cheered Bidens pick. Shes not @SenWarren but shes not from the Street, he wrote on Twitter.

dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so this is already wild, but then I got to the tangent section. It says Biden's also nominating Mike Pence as the *first female* Director of National Intelligence?

Biden will also nominate Linda Thomas-Greenfield as U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations and Antony Blinken as Secretary of State, and appoint Jake Sullivan as his national security advisor.
